dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 4470 RH: Protecting and Securing Chemical Facilities from Terrorist Attacks Act of 2023
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Lee of Florida (for herself and Mr. Green of Tennessee) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Homeland Security, and in addition to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned
Additional sponsors: Mr. Joyce of Ohio and Mr. Carl
Reported from the Committee on Homeland Security with an amendment
action.action-instruction: Strike out all after the enacting clause and insert the part printed in italic

action.action-desc: Committee on Energy and Commerce discharged; committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed
action.action-instruction: For text of introduced bill, see copy of bill as introduced on July 6, 2023

form.official-title: To extend the authorization of the Chemical Facility Anti-Terrorism Standards Program of the Department of Homeland Security.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Protecting and Securing Chemical Facilities from Terrorist Attacks Act of 2023.

section.header: Extension of authorization of Chemical Facility Anti-Terrorism Standards Program of the Department of Homeland Security
section.text: Section 5 of the Protecting and Securing Chemical Facilities from Terrorist Attacks Act of 2014 (Public Law 113–254; 6 U.S.C. 621 note) is amended by striking 2023 and inserting 2025.

endorsement.action-desc: Reported from the Committee on Homeland Security with an amendment
Committee on Energy and Commerce discharged; committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed
